knapsack module¶

An implementation of Knapsack problem

This is knapsack.py

knapsack.getMax(lst, f)[source]¶

Return the max item class object by the specified function.

Parameters

  • lst (list) – the list of item

  • f (function) – the function

class knapsack.item(weight, value, label)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for an object.

This is a class for an object that will be packed into the knapsack. An object has a label that identify the object, weight the total of which limits the capacity of the knapsack, value the total of which should be maximized.

weight¶

the weight of the object

Type

int

value¶

the value of the object

Type

int

label¶

the label of the object

Type

str

dump()[source]¶

Print the label, weight, and value of the object

getValue()[source]¶

Return the value of the object.

Returns

the value of the object

Return type

int

getWeight()[source]¶

Return the weight of the object.

Returns

the weight of the object

Return type

int

class knapsack.knapsack(itemlist)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for list of items

This class represents a list of item class. The packing algorithms should be implmented as methods of this class.

itemlist¶

the list of items

Type

list

dump()[source]¶

Print each object.

run(f, maxWeight=14)[source]¶

Print the packed items sorted by the specified functions.

Parameters

  • f (function) – this is the function whose return value ranks the order of selection

  • maxWeight (int, optional) – maximum capacity of the knapsack

setList(lst)[source]¶

Set the itemlist.

Parameters

itemlist (list) – a list of items

sort(f)[source]¶

Sort the list in the order specified function.

Parameters

f (function) – the key function for sorting

Returns

the sorted list of items

Return type

list
